verses.kjv: Behold, the day of the LORD cometh, and thy spoil shall be divided in the midst of thee.
verses.web: Behold, a day of LORD comes, when your plunder will be divided within you.
verses.ct: Pay attention — the day of the LORD is coming! When it arrives, your plunder will be divided right in your midst.

verses.kjv: For I will gather all nations against Jerusalem to battle; and the city shall be taken, and the houses rifled, and the women ravished; and half of the city shall go forth into captivity, and the residue of the people shall not be cut off from the city.
verses.web: For I will gather all nations against Jerusalem to battle; and the city will be taken, the houses rifled, and the women ravished. Half of the city will go out into captivity, and the rest of the people will not be cut off from the city.
verses.ct: "I will gather every nation against Jerusalem for battle. The city will be captured, the houses looted, and the women violated. Half the city will be dragged into captivity, but the rest of the people will not be removed from the city."

verses.kjv: Then shall the LORD go forth, and fight against those nations, as when he fought in the day of battle.
verses.web: Then LORD will go out and fight against those nations, as when he fought in the day of battle.
verses.ct: Then the LORD will march out and fight against those nations, just as he fights on a day of battle.

verses.kjv: And his feet shall stand in that day upon the mount of Olives, which is before Jerusalem on the east, and the mount of Olives shall cleave in the midst thereof toward the east and toward the west, and there shall be a very great valley; and half of the mountain shall remove toward the north, and half of it toward the south.
verses.web: His feet will stand in that day on the Mount of Olives, which is before Jerusalem on the east; and the Mount of Olives will be split in two, from east to west, making a very great valley. Half of the mountain will move toward the north, and half of it toward the south.
verses.ct: On that day, his feet will stand on the Mount of Olives, east of Jerusalem. The mountain will split in two from east to west, forming a massive valley — half the mountain shifting north and half shifting south.

verses.kjv: And ye shall flee to the valley of the mountains; for the valley of the mountains shall reach unto Azal: yea, ye shall flee, like as ye fled from before the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah: and the LORD my God shall come, and all the saints with thee.
verses.web: You shall flee by the valley of my mountains; for the valley of the mountains shall reach to Azel; yes, you shall flee, just like you fled from before the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah. LORD my God will come, and all the holy ones with you.
verses.ct: You will flee through this valley between the mountains, for it will stretch all the way to Azal. You will run for your lives, just as your ancestors fled from the earthquake during the reign of King Uzziah of Judah. Then the LORD my God will come, and all the holy ones with him.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the light shall not be clear, nor dark:
verses.web: It will happen in that day, that there will not be light, cold, or frost.
verses.ct: On that day, there will be no light — no clear skies and no darkness.

verses.kjv: But it shall be one day which shall be known to the LORD, not day, nor night: but it shall come to pass, that at evening time it shall be light.
verses.web: It will be a unique day which is known to LORD; not day, and not night; but it will come to pass, that at evening time there will be light.
verses.ct: It will be a day unlike any other, a day known only to the LORD. It won't be day or night, but when evening comes, there will still be light.

verses.kjv: And it shall be in that day, that living waters shall go out from Jerusalem; half of them toward the former sea, and half of them toward the hinder sea: in summer and in winter shall it be.
verses.web: It will happen in that day, that living waters will go out from Jerusalem: half of them toward the eastern sea, and half of them toward the western sea. It will be so in summer and in winter.
verses.ct: On that day, living waters will flow out from Jerusalem — half toward the Dead Sea in the east and half toward the Mediterranean Sea in the west. They will flow year-round, in summer and in winter.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall be king over all the earth: in that day shall there be one LORD, and his name one.
verses.web: LORD will be King over all the earth. In that day LORD will be one, and his name one.
verses.ct: The LORD will be king over the whole earth. On that day there will be one LORD, and his name alone will be worshiped.

verses.kjv: All the land shall be turned as a plain from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem: and it shall be lifted up, and inhabited in her place, from Benjamin’s gate unto the place of the first gate, unto the corner gate, and from the tower of Hananeel unto the king’s winepresses.
verses.web: All the land will be made like the Arabah, from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem; and she will be lifted up, and will dwell in her place, from Benjamin’s gate to the place of the first gate, to the corner gate, and from the tower of Hananel to the king’s wine presses.
verses.ct: The entire land from Geba to Rimmon, south of Jerusalem, will be flattened into a plain. But Jerusalem itself will be raised up and will remain in its place — from Benjamin's gate to the site of the first gate, all the way to the corner gate, and from the tower of Hananeel to the king's winepresses.

verses.kjv: And men shall dwell in it, and there shall be no more utter destruction; but Jerusalem shall be safely inhabited.
verses.web: Men will dwell therein, and there will be no more curse; but Jerusalem will dwell safely.
verses.ct: People will live there, and never again will the city face total destruction. Jerusalem will dwell in safety.

verses.kjv: And this shall be the plague wherewith the LORD will smite all the people that have fought against Jerusalem; Their flesh shall consume away while they stand upon their feet, and their eyes shall consume away in their holes, and their tongue shall consume away in their mouth.
verses.web: This will be the plague with which LORD will strike all the peoples who have fought against Jerusalem: their flesh will consume away while they stand on their feet, and their eyes will consume away in their sockets, and their tongue will consume away in their mouth.
verses.ct: This is the plague the LORD will strike against every nation that fought against Jerusalem: their flesh will rot while they're still standing on their feet, their eyes will rot in their sockets, and their tongues will rot in their mouths.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that a great tumult from the LORD shall be among them; and they shall lay hold every one on the hand of his neighbour, and his hand shall rise up against the hand of his neighbour.
verses.web: It will happen in that day, that a great panic from LORD will be among them; and they will each hold onto the hand of his neighbor, and his hand will rise up against the hand of his neighbor.
verses.ct: On that day, the LORD will throw them into a massive panic. Each man will grab his neighbor's hand, and then turn and attack him.

verses.kjv: And Judah also shall fight at Jerusalem; and the wealth of all the heathen round about shall be gathered together, gold, and silver, and apparel, in great abundance.
verses.web: Judah also will fight at Jerusalem; and the wealth of all the surrounding nations will be gathered together: gold, and silver, and clothing, in great abundance.
verses.ct: Judah too will fight at Jerusalem. The wealth of all the surrounding nations will be gathered up — gold, silver, and clothing in enormous quantities.

verses.kjv: And so shall be the plague of the horse, of the mule, of the camel, and of the ass, and of all the beasts that shall be in these tents, as this plague.
verses.web: A plague like this will fall on the horse, on the mule, on the camel, on the donkey, and on all the animals that will be in those camps.
verses.ct: That same plague will also strike the horses, mules, camels, donkeys, and every other animal in those enemy camps.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that every one that is left of all the nations which came against Jerusalem shall even go up from year to year to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, and to keep the feast of tabernacles.
verses.web: It will happen that everyone who is left of all the nations that came against Jerusalem will go up from year to year to worship the King, LORD of Armies, and to keep the feast of booths.
verses.ct: Then the survivors from every nation that attacked Jerusalem will go up year after year to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, and to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, that whoso will not come up of all the families of the earth unto Jerusalem to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, even upon them shall be no rain.
verses.web: It will be, that whoever of all the families of the earth doesn’t go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, LORD of Armies, on them there will be no rain.
verses.ct: If any nation on earth refuses to go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, no rain will fall on their land.

verses.kjv: And if the family of Egypt go not up, and come not, that have no rain; there shall be the plague, wherewith the LORD will smite the heathen that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacles.
verses.web: If the family of Egypt doesn’t go up, and doesn’t come, neither will it rain on them. This will be the plague with which LORD will strike the nations that don’t go up to keep the feast of booths.
verses.ct: If the people of Egypt refuse to go up and take part, they will receive no rain either. The LORD will strike them with the same plague he sends on any nation that doesn't come to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.

verses.kjv: This shall be the punishment of Egypt, and the punishment of all nations that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacles.
verses.web: This will be the punishment of Egypt, and the punishment of all the nations that don’t go up to keep the feast of booths.
verses.ct: This will be the punishment for Egypt and for every nation that refuses to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.

verses.kjv: In that day shall there be upon the bells of the horses, HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD; and the pots in the LORD’s house shall be like the bowls before the altar.
verses.web: In that day there will be on the bells of the horses, “HOLY TO YAHWEH”; and the pots in LORD’s house will be like the bowls before the altar.
verses.ct: On that day, even the bells on the horses will be inscribed with "HOLY TO THE LORD." The ordinary cooking pots in the LORD's house will be as sacred as the bowls used at the altar.

verses.kjv: Yea, every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah shall be holiness unto the LORD of hosts: and all they that sacrifice shall come and take of them, and seethe therein: and in that day there shall be no more the Canaanite in the house of the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: Yes, every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah will be holy to LORD of Armies; and all those who sacrifice will come and take of them, and cook in them. In that day there will no longer be a Canaanite in the house of LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: In fact, every pot in Jerusalem and Judah will be holy to the LORD of hosts. Everyone who comes to offer sacrifices will take these pots and cook in them. On that day, there will no longer be any merchant in the house of the LORD of hosts.
